result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica A Bird was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid within the first 6 months of probation.
To be paid within the first 6 months of probation.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. Not to enter any taverns or bars.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA  or similar type meeting per week.

Follow all recommendations and follow up on any plan upon release from any inpatient treatment.

records.addlTxt: Undecided

Defendant Jessica A Bird in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Jessica A Bird in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:38 PM. State - resolved - plead g/nc to count #1 and #2 as alleged, #3 - DRI, probation for 2 years with condition of: $500 fine plus costs and surcharges on each count, AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no entry into any taverns, bars, liquor stores or any other similar establishments, 100 hours of community service, employment/school. Joy and Bird agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #3. Bird pleads G to counts #1 and #2 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Joy makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Bird makes statement comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 - impose 9 months in FC jail, stayed, place on probation for 2 years, count #2 - 9 months in FC jail, concurrent to count #1, stayed, place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to count #1, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - paid within the first 6 months of probation, attend at least one AA/NA or similar type program each week, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service, follow all recommendations and follows follow up plan upon her release from any inpatient treatment, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, submit DNA sample with expunction right given, right to appeal, adjourned.
State
Final pre-trial on May 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jessica A Bird in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Defendant Jessica A Bird in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 3:14 PM. Also called 14CM253. Joy states that he is officially retained on both matters. Joy has received the revocation paperwork and finds no errors or inaccuracies. State informs Court that he has not received the revocation paperwork. Court updates State on counts that she is being revoked on. State makes argument prior to making recommendation - recommonds on 14CM90 - count #1 - 85 days in FC jail - credit for 45 days, count #3 - 6 months in FC jail - concurrent to count #1; 14CM90 - count #1 - 4 months in FC jail - consecutive to jail time on 14CM253. Joy makes argument prior to making recommendation - recommends possible time served and treatment. Bird makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 14CM90 - count #1 - 85 days in FC jail - credit for 45 days - good time and huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), #3 - 4 months in FC jail - consecutive to count #1 - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - huber and good time allowed - credit for 52 days; 14CM253 - 4 months in FC jail - concurrent to jail time on 14CM90 - eligible for huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - credit for 52 days, right to appeal, adjourned. Called 16CF30 at 3:47 PM. Joy is now retained on that matter, has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH, waives time limits. Court continues bond, considers time limits waived, sets for PH. State moves to amend bond to $2000.00 signature bond. Joy wants to keep bond as is. Court keeps bond as is. Court sets for PH on 5/23/ at 11:00 AM.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jessica A Bird in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:05 AM. Court asks the defendant why her attorney is not here (Lucareli). Bird states that she was informed that he cannot represent her in any matters in Forest County due to a conflict. Bird informs Court that she has contacted Jeff Joy and thought he was going to be here today. Court sets for another AIA but if Joy does appear this afternoon, we will recall the case.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jessica A Bird in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:38 AM. Bird said that she thought her attorney, Steve Lucareli, was supposed to be here today (per her Aunt Emily). Bird states she is on a PO hold. Court sets for another AIA. If Lucareli does appear today, we will recall the case.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.
No consumption of alcohol
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
No consumption of alcohol.

Defendant Jessica A Bird in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:57 AM. State - believes the defendant has been arrested off of a warrant for non-appearance in January of 2016. Bird states she has not received the complaint. State will provide one to her. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Bird understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, stated that her attorney, she has contacted and is out until 3/28/16 (Steve Lucareli). Court sets for AIA. State - bond - $750.00 cash for stated reasons. Court - bond - $750.00 cash, no consumption of alcohol.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Return on warrant/Initial appearance on March 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
transported from another facility(BRSO)
Warrant Detainer Brown County

Defendant Jessica A Bird not in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:46 AM. State - asks for forfeiture of any bond posted, bench warrant, body or $750.00. Court so orders.
No consumption of alcohol
